Package si.ijs.kt.clus.algo.rules

Class ClusRulesFromTree

java.lang.Object
si.ijs.kt.clus.algo.rules.ClusRulesFromTree
public class ClusRulesFromTree extends Object
Rule set created from a tree. Use by decision tree command line parameter.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected SettingsOutput.ConvertRules
    m_Mode
    Currently two modes are supported: Settings.CONVERT_RULES_LEAVES: Generate one rule for each leaf of the tree Settings.CONVERT_RULES_ALLNODES: Generate one rule for each node of the tree (including internal nodes) except for the root
    protected boolean
    m_Validated
    Has something to do with prediction validity.

  • Field Details

    • m_Validated

      protected boolean m_Validated
      Has something to do with prediction validity. If true, we only want to validate the rule construction if no other reason for creating is stated? Currently always true. This is also the only reason the class is not static...

    • m_Mode

      protected SettingsOutput.ConvertRules m_Mode
      Currently two modes are supported: Settings.CONVERT_RULES_LEAVES: Generate one rule for each leaf of the tree Settings.CONVERT_RULES_ALLNODES: Generate one rule for each node of the tree (including internal nodes) except for the root

  • Constructor Details

    • ClusRulesFromTree

      public ClusRulesFromTree(boolean onlyValidated, SettingsOutput.ConvertRules mode)
      The parameter seems to be always true?

  • Method Details

    • constructRules

      public ClusRuleSet constructRules(ClusRun cr, ClusNode node, ClusStatManager mgr, boolean computeDispersion, SettingsRules.RulePredictionMethod optimizeRuleWeights) throws ClusException, IOException, InterruptedException
      Same as constructRules(ClusNode node, ClusStatManager mgr) but with additional parameter - ClusRun to get access to the data set. This is for computing the data set dispersion.
      Parameters:
      cr - ClusRun
      node - The root node of the tree
      mgr - The data in statistics manager may be used.
      computeDispersion - Do we want to compute dispersion (and include the data to rule set).
      optimizeRuleWeights - Do we want to optimize the rule weight.
      Returns:
      The created rule set.
      Throws:
      ClusException
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • constructOptionRules

      public ClusRuleSet constructOptionRules(ClusRun cr, MyNode node, ClusStatManager mgr, boolean computeDispersion, SettingsRules.RulePredictionMethod optimizeRuleWeights) throws ClusException, IOException, InterruptedException
      Throws:
      ClusException
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • constructRules

      public ClusRuleSet constructRules(ClusNode node, ClusStatManager mgr) throws ClusException
      Construct rules from terminal nodes of the given tree. Does not do any processing like dispersion or weight optimization. Especially used when transforming multiple trees to rules.
      Parameters:
      node - The root node of the tree
      mgr - The data in statistics manager may be used
      Throws:
      ClusException

    • constructOptionRules

      public ClusRuleSet constructOptionRules(MyNode node, ClusStatManager mgr)
      Option tree conversion

    • constructRecursive

      public void constructRecursive(ClusNode node, ClusRule rule, ClusRuleSet set)
      Only terminal nodes are added to rule set

    • constructRecursiveOption

      public void constructRecursiveOption(MyNode node, ClusRule rule, ClusRuleSet set)
      Only terminal nodes are added to rule set (OPTION TREE)
